maml:description.maml:para: Get error details.
Gets a list of image or video errors for the transformations requested in the last three days.
> Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Your policy set's ID.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
The maximum number of logs per day.
Limits search results to a specific image or video URL.
A size breakpoint, in pixels, configured in the policy. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-PolicyID` parameters.
Filters the results to include transformations done in `REALTIME` or queued for `OFFLINE` processing. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-Size`, and `-PolicyID` parameters.
A type of network to execute the API request on, either `Staging` or `Production`.
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The maximum number of logs per day.
A type of network to execute the API request on, either `Staging` or `Production`.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.
Your policy set's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
A size breakpoint, in pixels, configured in the policy. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-PolicyID` parameters.
Filters the results to include transformations done in `REALTIME` or queued for `OFFLINE` processing. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-Size`, and `-PolicyID` parameters.
Limits search results to a specific image or video URL.
Get an image.
Gets a specific image by its ID.
> Note: if your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts you need to specify the contract ID.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The ID of the image. This ID usually represents the part of the URL after the scheme, host, and port.
A type of network to execute the API request on, either `Staging` or `Production`.
Your policy set's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Get a policy.
Gets all policies assigned to a specified policy set or returns a specific policy by its ID. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.

Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.

Get policy history.
Gets the policy history by its policy ID. The operation returns the full state of the policy at various points in time.
> Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Your policy set's ID.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.

Get a policy set.
Gets all IVM policy sets or returns a specific policy set by its ID.
> Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Your policy set's ID.
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Create or modify a policy.
Creates a new IVM policy. Make sure to check whether a policy with the specified ID doesn't already exist by running the `Get-IVMPolicy` operation. Otherwise, the existing policy will be updated.
> Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to provide the contract ID.
Your policy set's ID.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.
A type of network to execute the API request on, either `Staging` or `Production`.
Your contract's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
A type of network to execute the API request on, either `Staging` or `Production`.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.
Your policy set's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Create a policy set.
Creates a new IVM policy set of either the `IMAGE` or `VIDEO` type in a specified geographic region. You can tab through the `-Region` and `-Type` options to see what values are acceptable.
> Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your contract's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your contract's ID.
The default policy to deploy the policy set with. If unspecified, the policy set will use the system default.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
A human-readable name for the policy set.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and requires their transformation again.
The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The type of media this policy set manages, either `IMAGE` or `VIDEO`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your contract's ID.
The default policy to deploy the policy set with. If unspecified, the policy set will use the system default.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
A human-readable name for the policy set.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and requires their transformation again.
The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The type of media this policy set manages, either `IMAGE` or `VIDEO`.
Remove a policy.
Deletes a specific policy.

Delete a policy set.
Deletes a policy set from a specified contract on both networks.

The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Roll back a policy.
Reverts the previous version of the policy and deploys it to the network. Use this operation to stop and reverse a policy rollout.
Your policy set's ID.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.

Create or modify a policy.
Updates an existing IVM policy. Make sure to check whether the policy with the specified ID already exists by running the `Get-IVMPolicy` operation. If it doesn't, this function will create it.
> Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to provide the contract ID.
Your policy set's ID.
Your image or video policy's ID. To get a policy's ID, run `Get-IVMPolicy`. Use in conjunction with the `-Url`, `-TransformationType`, and `-Size` parameters.
A type of network to execute the API request on, either `Staging` or `Production`.
Your contract's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

Update a policy set.
Updates the `-Name` or `-Region` of an existing policy set on both networks.
Your policy set's ID.
A human-readable name for the policy set.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and requires their transformation again.
The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
